Description: Papyrus; Hieroglyphic and Hieratic text. Top is 'Geographcial papyrus' Bottom row of fragments is hieratic text (both sides), religious. Now numbered 10673B.
Curator's comments: Published in Griffith and Petrie, Two Hieroglyphic Papyri from Tanis (London, 1889). To be published by Jasnow.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380871) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380871)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: carbonised, brittle, salt precipitate, displaced fragments Black ink Adhered: gelatin (spots, cracked) Transferred to horizontal storage 30 DEC 94 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E Curatorial condition comment: poor
